content:
HttpResponseWrapper Class

In this Article

Encapsulates the HTTP intrinsic object that provides HTTP-response information from an ASP.NET operation.

Syntax

Declaration

public class HttpResponseWrapper : System.Web.HttpResponseBase

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Web.HttpResponseBase
  • HttpResponseWrapper

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

The HttpResponseWrapper class derives from the HttpResponseBase class and serves as a wrapper for the HttpResponse class. This class exposes the functionality of the HttpResponse class while also exposing the HttpResponseBase type. The HttpResponseBase class enables you to replace the original implementation of the HttpResponse class in your application with a custom implementation, such as when you perform unit testing outside the ASP.NET pipeline.

Constructors summary

HttpResponseWrapper(HttpResponse)

Initializes a new instance of the HttpResponseWrapper class.

Properties summary

Buffer

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to buffer output and send it after the complete response has finished processing.
BufferOutput

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to buffer output and send it after the complete page has finished processing.
Cache

Gets the caching policy (such as expiration time, privacy settings, and vary clauses) of the current Web page.
CacheControl

Gets or sets the Cache-Control HTTP header that matches one of the HttpCacheability enumeration values.
Charset

Gets or sets the HTTP character set of the current response.
ContentEncoding

Gets or sets the content encoding of the current response.
ContentType

Gets or sets the HTTP MIME type of the current response.
Cookies

Gets the response cookie collection.
Expires

Gets or sets the number of minutes before a page that is cached on the client or proxy expires. If the user returns to the same page before it expires, the cached version is displayed. Expires is provided for compatibility with earlier versions of ASP.
ExpiresAbsolute

Gets or sets the absolute date and time at which cached information expires in the cache. ExpiresAbsolute is provided for compatibility with earlier versions of ASP.
Filter

Gets or sets a filter object that is used to modify the HTTP entity body before transmission.
HeaderEncoding

Gets or sets the encoding for the header of the current response.
Headers

Gets the collection of response headers.
IsClientConnected

Gets a value that indicates whether the client is connected to the server.
IsRequestBeingRedirected

Gets a value that indicates whether the client is being redirected to a new location.
Output

Gets the object that enables output of text to the outgoing HTTP response stream.
OutputStream

Provides binary output to the outgoing HTTP content body.
RedirectLocation

Gets or sets the value of the HTTP Location header.
Status

Sets the Status value that is returned to the client.
StatusCode

Gets or sets the HTTP status code of the output that is returned to the client.
StatusDescription

Gets or sets the HTTP status message of the output that is returned to the client.
SubStatusCode

Gets or sets a value that qualifies the status code of the response.
SuppressContent

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to send HTTP content to the client.
TrySkipIisCustomErrors

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether IIS 7.0 custom errors are disabled.

Methods summary

AddCacheDependency(CacheDependency[])

When overridden in a derived class, associates cache dependencies with the response that enable the response to be invalidated if it is cached and if the specified dependencies change.
AddCacheItemDependencies(ArrayList)

Makes the validity of a cached response dependent on the specified items in the cache.
AddCacheItemDependencies(String[])

Makes the validity of a cached item dependent on the specified items in the cache.
AddCacheItemDependency(String)

Makes the validity of a cached response dependent on the specified item in the cache.
AddFileDependencies(ArrayList)

Adds file names to the collection of file names on which the current response is dependent.
AddFileDependencies(String[])

Adds an array of file names to the collection of file names on which the current response is dependent.
AddFileDependency(String)

Adds a single file name to the collection of file names on which the current response is dependent.
AddHeader(String,String)

Adds an HTTP header to the current response. This method is provided for compatibility with earlier versions of ASP.
AppendCookie(HttpCookie)

Adds an HTTP cookie to the HTTP response cookie collection.
AppendHeader(String,String)

Adds an HTTP header to the current response.
AppendToLog(String)

Adds custom log information to the Internet Information Services (IIS) log file.
ApplyAppPathModifier(String)

Adds a session ID to the virtual path if the session is using stem.Web.Configuration.SessionStateSection.Cookieless* session state, and returns the combined path.
BinaryWrite(Byte[])

Writes a string of binary characters to the HTTP output stream.
Clear()

Clears all headers and content output from the current response.
ClearContent()

Clears all content output from the current response.
ClearHeaders()

Clears all headers from the current response.
Close()

Closes the socket connection to a client.
DisableKernelCache()

Disables kernel caching for the current response.
End()

Sends all currently buffered output to the client, stops execution of the requested process, and raises the EndRequest event.
Flush()

Sends all currently buffered output to the client.
Pics(String)

Appends an HTTP PICS-Label header to the current response.
Redirect(String)

Redirects a request to the specified URL.
Redirect(String,Boolean)

Redirects a request to the specified URL and specifies whether execution of the current process should terminate.
RemoveOutputCacheItem(String)

Removes from the cache all cached items that are associated with the specified path.
SetCookie(HttpCookie)

Updates an existing cookie in the cookie collection.
TransmitFile(String)

Writes the specified file to the HTTP response output stream, without buffering it in memory.
TransmitFile(String,Int64,Int64)

Writes the specified part of a file to the HTTP response output stream, without buffering it in memory.
Write(Char)

Writes a character to an HTTP response output stream.
Write(Object)

Writes the specified object to the HTTP response stream.
Write(String)

Writes the specified string to the HTTP response output stream.
Write(Char[],Int32,Int32)

Writes the specified array of characters to the HTTP response output stream.
WriteFile(String)

Writes the contents of the specified file to the HTTP response output stream as a file block.
WriteFile(String,Boolean)

Writes the contents of the specified file to the HTTP response output stream and specifies whether the content is written as a memory block.
WriteFile(IntPtr,Int64,Int64)

Writes the specified file to the HTTP response output stream.
WriteFile(String,Int64,Int64)

Writes the specified file to the HTTP response output stream.
WriteSubstitution(HttpResponseSubstitutionCallback)

Inserts substitution blocks into the response, which enables dynamic generation of regions for cached output responses.

Constructors

  • HttpResponseWrapper(HttpResponse)

    Initializes a new instance of the HttpResponseWrapper class.

    public HttpResponseWrapper (System.Web.HttpResponse httpResponse);

    Parameters

    • httpResponse
      HttpResponse

      The object that this wrapper class provides access to.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The httpResponse parameter is null.

Properties

  • Buffer

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to buffer output and send it after the complete response has finished processing.

    public override bool Buffer { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the output is buffered; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The Buffer property of the HttpResponseWrapper class has been deprecated in favor of the BufferOutput property and is provided only for compatibility with earlier versions of ASP.

  • BufferOutput

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to buffer output and send it after the complete page has finished processing.

    public override bool BufferOutput { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the output is buffered; otherwise false. The default is true.

  • Cache

    Gets the caching policy (such as expiration time, privacy settings, and vary clauses) of the current Web page.

    public override System.Web.HttpCachePolicyBase Cache { get; }

    Property Value

    • HttpCachePolicyBase

      The caching policy of the current response.

  • CacheControl

    Gets or sets the Cache-Control HTTP header that matches one of the HttpCacheability enumeration values.

    public override string CacheControl { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The caching policy of the current response.

  • Charset

    Gets or sets the HTTP character set of the current response.

    public override string Charset { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The HTTP character set of the current response.

  • ContentEncoding

    Gets or sets the content encoding of the current response.

    public override System.Text.Encoding ContentEncoding { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Encoding

      The information about the content encoding of the current response.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      Attempted to set stem.Web.HttpResponse.ContentEncoding* to null.

  • ContentType

    Gets or sets the HTTP MIME type of the current response.

    public override string ContentType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The HTTP MIME type of the current response. The default value is "text/html".

    Exceptions

    • HttpException

      The stem.Web.HttpResponse.ContentType* property is set to null.

  • Cookies

    Gets the response cookie collection.

    public override System.Web.HttpCookieCollection Cookies { get; }

    Property Value

    • HttpCookieCollection

      The response cookie collection.

  • Expires

    Gets or sets the number of minutes before a page that is cached on the client or proxy expires. If the user returns to the same page before it expires, the cached version is displayed. Expires is provided for compatibility with earlier versions of ASP.

    public override int Expires { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The number of minutes before the page expires.

  • ExpiresAbsolute

    Gets or sets the absolute date and time at which cached information expires in the cache. ExpiresAbsolute is provided for compatibility with earlier versions of ASP.

    public override DateTime ExpiresAbsolute { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • DateTime

      The date and time at which the page expires.

  • Filter

    Gets or sets a filter object that is used to modify the HTTP entity body before transmission.

    public override System.IO.Stream Filter { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Stream

      An object that acts as the output filter.

  • HeaderEncoding

    Gets or sets the encoding for the header of the current response.

    public override System.Text.Encoding HeaderEncoding { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Encoding

      The information about the encoding for the current header.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The encoding value is null.

    • HttpException

      The encoding value is stem.Text.Encoding.Unicode*.

      - or -

      The headers have already been sent.

  • Headers

    Gets the collection of response headers.

    public override System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection Headers { get; }

    Property Value

    • NameValueCollection

      The response headers.

    Exceptions

    • PlatformNotSupportedException

      The operation requires the integrated pipeline mode in IIS 7.0 and at least the .NET Framework version 3.0.

  • IsClientConnected

    Gets a value that indicates whether the client is connected to the server.

    public override bool IsClientConnected { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the client is currently connected; otherwise, false.

  • IsRequestBeingRedirected

    Gets a value that indicates whether the client is being redirected to a new location.

    public override bool IsRequestBeingRedirected { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the value of the location response header differs from the current location; otherwise, false.

  • Output

    Gets the object that enables output of text to the outgoing HTTP response stream.

    public override System.IO.TextWriter Output { get; }

    Property Value

    • TextWriter

      An object that enables custom output to the client.

  • OutputStream

    Provides binary output to the outgoing HTTP content body.

    public override System.IO.Stream OutputStream { get; }

    Property Value

    • Stream

      An object that represents the raw contents of the outgoing HTTP content body.

  • RedirectLocation

    Gets or sets the value of the HTTP Location header.

    public override string RedirectLocation { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The absolute URL of the HTTP Location header.

  • Status

    Sets the Status value that is returned to the client.

    public override string Status { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The status of the HTTP output. The default value is "200 (OK)". For information about valid status codes, see HTTP Status Codes on the MSDN Web site.

    Exceptions

    • HttpException

      Status is set to an invalid status code.

  • StatusCode

    Gets or sets the HTTP status code of the output that is returned to the client.

    public override int StatusCode { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The status code of the HTTP output that is returned to the client. The default value is 200. For information about valid status codes, see HTTP Status Codes on the MSDN Web site.

    Exceptions

    • HttpException

      stem.Web.HttpResponse.StatusCode* was set after the HTTP headers were sent.

  • StatusDescription

    Gets or sets the HTTP status message of the output that is returned to the client.

    public override string StatusDescription { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The status message of the HTTP output that is returned to the client. The default value is "OK". For information about valid status codes, see HTTP Status Codes on the MSDN Web site.

    Exceptions

    • HttpException

      StatusDescription was set after the HTTP headers were sent.

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The status value is longer than 512 characters.

  • SubStatusCode

    Gets or sets a value that qualifies the status code of the response.

    public override int SubStatusCode { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The IIS 7.0 substatus code.

    Exceptions

    • PlatformNotSupportedException

      The operation requires the integrated pipeline mode in IIS 7.0 and at least the .NET Framework version 3.0.

    • HttpException

      The status code was set after all HTTP headers were sent.

  • SuppressContent

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to send HTTP content to the client.

    public override bool SuppressContent { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if output is suppressed; otherwise, false.

  • TrySkipIisCustomErrors

    Gets or sets a value that specifies whether IIS 7.0 custom errors are disabled.

    public override bool TrySkipIisCustomErrors { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if IIS 7.0 custom errors are disabled; otherwise, false.

Methods

  • AddCacheDependency(CacheDependency[])

    When overridden in a derived class, associates cache dependencies with the response that enable the response to be invalidated if it is cached and if the specified dependencies change.

    public override void AddCacheDependency (System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency[] dependencies);

    Parameters

    • dependencies
      CacheDependency[]

      A file, cache key, or CacheDependency object to add to the list of application dependencies.

  • AddCacheItemDependencies(ArrayList)

    Makes the validity of a cached response dependent on the specified items in the cache.

    public override void AddCacheItemDependencies (System.Collections.ArrayList cacheKeys);

    Parameters

    • cacheKeys
      ArrayList

      A collection that contains the keys of the items that the cached response is dependent on.

  • AddCacheItemDependencies(String[])

    Makes the validity of a cached item dependent on the specified items in the cache.

    public override void AddCacheItemDependencies (string[] cacheKeys);

    Parameters

    • cacheKeys
      String[]

      An array that contains the keys of the items that the cached response is dependent on.

  • AddCacheItemDependency(String)

    Makes the validity of a cached response dependent on the specified item in the cache.

    public override void AddCacheItemDependency (string cacheKey);

    Parameters

    • cacheKey
      String

      The key of the item that the cached response is dependent on.

  • AddFileDependencies(ArrayList)

    Adds file names to the collection of file names on which the current response is dependent.

    public override void AddFileDependencies (System.Collections.ArrayList filenames);

    Parameters

    • filenames
      ArrayList

      The names of the files to add.

  • AddFileDependencies(String[])

    Adds an array of file names to the collection of file names on which the current response is dependent.

    public override void AddFileDependencies (string[] filenames);

    Parameters

    • filenames
      String[]

      An array of files names to add.

  • AddFileDependency(String)

    Adds a single file name to the collection of file names on which the current response is dependent.

    public override void AddFileDependency (string filename);

    Parameters

    • filename
      String

      The name of the file to add.

  • AddHeader(String,String)

    Adds an HTTP header to the current response. This method is provided for compatibility with earlier versions of ASP.

    public override void AddHeader (string name, string value);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the HTTP header to add value to.

    • value
      String

      The string to add to the header.

  • AppendCookie(HttpCookie)

    Adds an HTTP cookie to the HTTP response cookie collection.

    public override void AppendCookie (System.Web.HttpCookie cookie);

    Parameters

    • cookie
      HttpCookie

      The cookie to add to the response.

    Exceptions

    • HttpException

      The cookie was added after the HTTP headers were sent.

  • AppendHeader(String,String)

    Adds an HTTP header to the current response.

    public override void AppendHeader (string name, string value);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the HTTP header to add to the current response.

    • value
      String

      The value of the header.

    Exceptions

    • HttpException

      The header was appended after the HTTP headers were sent.

  • AppendToLog(String)

    Adds custom log information to the Internet Information Services (IIS) log file.

    public override void AppendToLog (string param);

    Parameters

    • param
      String

      The text to add to the log file.

  • ApplyAppPathModifier(String)

    Adds a session ID to the virtual path if the session is using stem.Web.Configuration.SessionStateSection.Cookieless* session state, and returns the combined path.

    public override string ApplyAppPathModifier (string virtualPath);

    Parameters

    • virtualPath
      String

      The virtual path of a resource.

    Returns

    • String

      The virtual path with the session ID inserted. If stem.Web.Configuration.SessionStateSection.Cookieless* session state is not used, returns the original virtualpath value.

  • BinaryWrite(Byte[])

    Writes a string of binary characters to the HTTP output stream.

    public override void BinaryWrite (byte[] buffer);

    Parameters

    • buffer
      Byte[]

      The binary characters to write to the current response.

  • Clear()

    Clears all headers and content output from the current response.

    public override void Clear ();
  • ClearContent()

    Clears all content output from the current response.

    public override void ClearContent ();
  • ClearHeaders()

    Clears all headers from the current response.

    public override void ClearHeaders ();
  • Close()

    Closes the socket connection to a client.

    public override void Close ();
  • DisableKernelCache()

    Disables kernel caching for the current response.

    public override void DisableKernelCache ();
  • End()

    Sends all currently buffered output to the client, stops execution of the requested process, and raises the EndRequest event.

    public override void End ();

    Exceptions

    • ThreadAbortException

      The call to stem.Web.HttpResponse.End* has terminated the current request.

  • Flush()

    Sends all currently buffered output to the client.

    public override void Flush ();

    Exceptions

    • HttpException

      The method was called after the response was finished.

  • Pics(String)

    Appends an HTTP PICS-Label header to the current response.

    public override void Pics (string value);

    Parameters

    • value
      String

      The string to add to the PICS-Label header.

  • Redirect(String)

    Redirects a request to the specified URL.

    public override void Redirect (string url);

    Parameters

    • url
      String

      The target location.

    Exceptions

    • HttpException

      Redirection was attempted after the HTTP headers were sent.

  • Redirect(String,Boolean)

    Redirects a request to the specified URL and specifies whether execution of the current process should terminate.

    public override void Redirect (string url, bool endResponse);

    Parameters

    • url
      String

      The target location.

    • endResponse
      Boolean

      true to terminate the current process.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      url is null.

    • ArgumentException

      url contains a newline character.

    • HttpException

      Redirection was attempted after the HTTP headers were sent.

    • ApplicationException

      The request is the result of a callback.

  • RemoveOutputCacheItem(String)

    Removes from the cache all cached items that are associated with the specified path.

    public override void RemoveOutputCacheItem (string path);

    Parameters

    • path
      String

      The virtual absolute path to the items to be removed from the cache.

  • SetCookie(HttpCookie)

    Updates an existing cookie in the cookie collection.

    public override void SetCookie (System.Web.HttpCookie cookie);

    Parameters

    • cookie
      HttpCookie

      The cookie in the collection to be updated.

    Exceptions

    • HttpException

      The cookie was set after the HTTP headers were sent.

  • TransmitFile(String)

    Writes the specified file to the HTTP response output stream, without buffering it in memory.

    public override void TransmitFile (string filename);

    Parameters

    • filename
      String

      The name of the file to write to the HTTP output stream.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      filename is null

  • TransmitFile(String,Int64,Int64)

    Writes the specified part of a file to the HTTP response output stream, without buffering it in memory.

    public override void TransmitFile (string filename, long offset, long length);

    Parameters

    • filename
      String

      The name of the file to write to the HTTP output stream.

    • offset
      Int64

      The position in the file where writing starts.

    • length
      Int64

      The number of bytes to write, starting at offset.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The offset parameter is less than zero.

      - or -

      The length parameter is less than -1.

      - or -

      The length parameter is greater than the file size minus offset.

    • PlatformNotSupportedException

      The out-of-process worker request is not supported.

      - or -

      The response is not using a HttpWriter object.

  • Write(Char)

    Writes a character to an HTTP response output stream.

    public override void Write (char ch);

    Parameters

    • ch
      Char

      The character to write to the HTTP output stream.

  • Write(Object)

    Writes the specified object to the HTTP response stream.

    public override void Write (object obj);

    Parameters

    • obj
      Object

      The object to write to the HTTP output stream.

  • Write(String)

    Writes the specified string to the HTTP response output stream.

    public override void Write (string s);

    Parameters

    • s
      String

      The string to write to the HTTP output stream.

  • Write(Char[],Int32,Int32)

    Writes the specified array of characters to the HTTP response output stream.

    public override void Write (char[] buffer, int index, int count);

    Parameters

    • buffer
      Char[]

      The character array to write.

    • index
      Int32

      The position in the character array where writing starts.

    • count
      Int32

      The number of characters to write, starting at index.

  • WriteFile(String)

    Writes the contents of the specified file to the HTTP response output stream as a file block.

    public override void WriteFile (string filename);

    Parameters

    • filename
      String

      The name of the file to write to the HTTP output stream.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The filename parameter is null.

  • WriteFile(String,Boolean)

    Writes the contents of the specified file to the HTTP response output stream and specifies whether the content is written as a memory block.

    public override void WriteFile (string filename, bool readIntoMemory);

    Parameters

    • filename
      String

      The name of the file to write to the current response.

    • readIntoMemory
      Boolean

      true to write the file into a memory block.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The filename parameter is null.

  • WriteFile(IntPtr,Int64,Int64)

    Writes the specified file to the HTTP response output stream.

    public override void WriteFile (IntPtr fileHandle, long offset, long size);

    Parameters

    • fileHandle
      IntPtr

      The file handle of the file to write to the HTTP output stream.

    • offset
      Int64

      The position in the file where writing starts.

    • size
      Int64

      The number of bytes to write, starting at offset.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      fileHandle is null.

    • HttpException

      offset is less than 0.

      - or -

      size is greater than the file size minus offset.

  • WriteFile(String,Int64,Int64)

    Writes the specified file to the HTTP response output stream.

    public override void WriteFile (string filename, long offset, long size);

    Parameters

    • filename
      String

      The name of the file to write to the HTTP output stream.

    • offset
      Int64

      The position in the file where writing starts.

    • size
      Int64

      The number of bytes to write, starting at offset.

    Exceptions

    • HttpException

      offset is less than 0.

      - or -

      size is greater than the file size minus offset.

  • WriteSubstitution(HttpResponseSubstitutionCallback)

    Inserts substitution blocks into the response, which enables dynamic generation of regions for cached output responses.

    public override void WriteSubstitution (System.Web.HttpResponseSubstitutionCallback callback);

    Parameters

    • callback
      HttpResponseSubstitutionCallback

      The method, user control, or object to substitute.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The target of the callback parameter is of type Control.
